WorkItem.Description:
Ah! An epiphany! An error in a part of the script that writes a few functions (accidentally) wrote an indefinite circular reference, which caused the calculation engine to loop endlessly (and sucking up resources) as it tried to reach the end of the formula...
Â 
I guess circular reference checking should be added to the feature list?
WorkItem.Summary: Checking for Circular References in Formulae

Comments.Message:
Modified the code to throw an exception or raise an error when it encounters a cyclic reference while calculating a formula.
Plan to make further modification to allow behaviour to be modified in this circumstance in a similar fashion to Excel itself (either trigger an error, or allow x iterations of the cycle before returning a value).
Need to modify writer to trap for exception/error when calling getCalculatedValue, and make appropriate noises.
Should probably also trigger a calculation when user modifies a formula so that this situation can be trapped immediately
SVN code now allows multiple iterations (limited by a configuration setting) over cyclic references
